info.author: Heitor Polidoro
info.description:
# Colors [![Latest](https://img.shields.io/github/release/heitorpolidoro/colors.svg?label=latest)](https://github.com/heitorpolidoro/colors/releases/latest) Set of constants to simplify print with colors #### How to use: ``` from colors import * print(Red, 'Error') ``` Error The package creates a wrapper in the default `print` to remove the color on every print. So you don't have to worry to put the `Color_Off`. ``` print('This is ', Green, 'Green.') print('This is not.') ``` This is Green.
This is not. Unless you really wanted to ``` print(Blue, 'Color on', Color_Off, ' Color off') ``` Color on Color off **SIDE EFFECTS** The wrapper removes single spaces strings (`" "`) so this: ``` print('Hello', 'World') ``` Will print: `HelloWorld` instead of `Hello World`.
info.name: polidoro-py-colors
info.summary: Set of constants to simplify print with colors.
info.html_description:
Colors

Set of constants to simplify print with colors

How to use:

from colors import *
print(Red, 'Error')

Error

The package creates a wrapper in the default print to remove the color on every print. So you don't have to worry to put the Color_Off.

print('This is ', Green, 'Green.')
print('This is not.')

This is Green.
This is not.

Unless you really wanted to

print(Blue, 'Color on', Color_Off, ' Color off')

Color on Color off

SIDE EFFECTS

The wrapper removes single spaces strings (" ") so this:

print('Hello', 'World')

Will print: HelloWorld instead of Hello World.
